name: Rules of My Shop

quests.name: Vending Machine (Buy)
quests.description:
So, despite what my sister may have told you, you might have some issues finding Vending Machines in villages.
    Yeah, seems some hooligans have been seen stealing them and throwing them in Lava? Apparently they say it makes pretty neat colors but...it just kind of lights on fire and dissappears....
    Anyways I have some for sale at least. A bit expensive but there ya go.

quests.name: TFB Portable Shipping System
quests.description:
If you've not noticed, it does not matter which TFB Shipping System you use, you always see your OWN Shipping Interface. That's part of the magic my sister has programmed into this.
    We have available a.... smartphone version of the Shipping System. Same idea, just useable on the go.

quests.name: Snow Globe Gamble
quests.description:
So, according to my sister, some crazy chaos mage couldn't decide what to build his wizard house out of, so he invented this thing.
    The Chance Globe, when you place it down, can become almost ANY block in the world after about 10 seconds.
    There's a good chance you'll just get stone or wood. But you may just get a block of Diamond, yeah?

quests.name: Forbidden Knowledge Coin
quests.description:
So Traveler. My sister and I came up with a good way to... incentivize you into both completing her lessons, and in selling resources to me.
   They are called Forbidden Knowledge Coins. 
    You can complete each lesson for one of these coins. Or you can earn money, and buy them from me directly. 
    You can then spend these Forbidden Knowledge Coins to have us Unlock Lost Knowledge for you. Each Lost Knowledge Unlock costs a different amount of Coins, so keep working hard!

quests.name: Shipping Goods
quests.description:
The TFB Shipping System magically condenses items and converts them to other items we sell. Handy, huh?
    But what if you want the coins to trade with other Travellers, or buy Forbidden Knowledge Coins (they can't be purchased through the Shipping System for security reasons!)?
    Then you will want to pull out a TFB Shipping Crate and sell it to me through either this shop tablet, or the TFB Market!

tasks.longDescription:
You can only make a crate when you've turned in 100 Gold Dubloons worth of resources.
    For a ONE TIME bonus, Traveller, I'll buy one TFB Shipping Crate for a Forbidden Knowledge Coin. That's over twice the value!

quests.name: Selling Goods
quests.description:
Now, Kow is providing you some rewards for following her lessons right? Well, and selling her some stuff she requests, of course. That's all good.
    But she generally will only make the offer good once. I, however, will always purchase things I list.
    Most things I wish to purchase will be on the RIGHT side of the tablet, okay? For example, I'll always buy simple Sushi.

quests.name: Interdimensional Gamble
quests.description:
So one of the products I just got my hands on is a bit interesting.
   The TFB Captain's Blind Box seems to contain one item out of over a thousand options. 99% of the items fall under the following criteria : white, pink, purple, gemstone, sushi.
    Where is it from? What is TFB? I'll leave those a mystery for now, Traveller!

tasks.longDescription: Monsters also drop these things rarely, so keep an eye out for them! They like to gamble too, you know!

quests.name: About My Shop
quests.description:
Excellent, welcome to my shop, Traveler. I've got wares from all over, including what Kow says is your old world. 
    This stuff doesn't come cheap, however. Kow and I have to do a lot of magic rituals to get this stuff to work in your dimension.
    The good news? Not only can you earn money by following Kow's instructions, but I'll also buy many things from you!

tasks.longDescription:
For now, bring me a "Gold Dubloon." This is the standard payment for items, worth 100 Copper Dubloons. You can craft it by combining Copper, Iron, and Silver Dubloons.
    Bring me one and I'll give you a gift for super cheap, deal?

quests.name: TFB Shipping System
quests.description:
So, I know that selling anything to me is a bit of a hassle if you are just using this Shop Tablet. But, with the TFB Shipping System, you can magically condense items into what we call eDubloons.
    Anything you can sell in this tablet, you can put into the TFB Shipping System. You can also automatically convert them into ALMOST any item you can buy. (Things like Terrasteel can only be sold through the tablet).
    PLEASE READ THE SIDEBAR, TRAVELER! IT'S IMPORTANT!

tasks.longDescription:
Just like the shop, items you sell net you 20 PERCENT of the buy price. Be careful to not put items you just purchased back in! Can't refund!
    Be sure to insert the Shipping Manifest into the Shipping System!

quests.name: Basic and Not So Basic
quests.description:
My shop pages are split into two sections, for your convenience.
    The first section is basic items. Unrefined resources, simple items. The basics, Traveler.
    The other section contains more complex things. Things Kow and I have to work our knowledge on to get to your world. So they will be much more... expensive.

quests.name: The Price of Knowledge
quests.description:
Now, we can get technology to you two ways, Traveler.
    The first way is easy. You can buy specific things from me for a price. It is expensive, but not as much as the raw materials really.
    The other way is empowering you with what they called Lost Knowledge. It's very expensive, as the reagents for the rituals are nothing to sneeze at.
    But what you get is the ability to make everything from a section of Lost Knowledge yourself. And that is infinitely cheaper than buying everything from me.

quests.name: The TFB Market
quests.description:
The TFB Market is available to automate the buying of Diamonds, Emeralds, and all Silent's Gems. To sell gems, you'll need a different TFB product.

    So, what does TFB mean? Oh, just the name of one of my businesses, not to worry.

quests.name: TFB Shipping Crate (Sell)
quests.description: Got some TFB Shipping Crates to sell? Toss em all to me!

quests.name: TFB Debit Cards
quests.description:
Another way for you to hold and transfer eDubloons is by putting them into a Debit Card. The TFB Shipping System has an area for multiple Debit Cards. When you put a Debit Card in, all eDubloons are automatically deposited onto it. 
    Items you purchase will draw from the Cards first. You can't transfer eDubloons back into the Shipping Table, but you can transfer card to card by putting  card on the center of the right hand circle.

tasks.longDescription:
The first tier of TFB Debit Card is the Copper tier. You can get a higher tier Debit Card by combining four lower tiers. Four Copper Debit Cards become an Iron Debit Card.
   Keep going until you reach Singularity!

description: Before you peruse my wares, you might want to see what my shop is all about?
